DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/devices/po.description: Deletes a device settings profile and fetches a list of the remaining profiles for an account.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

allow_mode_switch.description: Whether to allow the user to switch WARP between modes.

allow_updates.description: Whether to receive update notifications when a new version of the client is available.

allowed_to_leave.description: Whether to allow devices to leave the organization.

auto_connect.description: The amount of time in minutes to reconnect after having been disabled.

captive_portal.description: Turn on the captive portal after the specified amount of time.

default.description: Whether the policy is the default policy for an account.

description.description: A description of the policy.
description.example: Policy for test teams.

disable_auto_fallback.description: If the `dns_server` field of a fallback domain is not present, the client will fall back to a best guess of the default/system DNS resolvers unless this policy option is set to `true`.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

address.description: The address in CIDR format to exclude from the tunnel. If `address` is present, `host` must not be present.

description.description: A description of the Split Tunnel item, displayed in the client UI.
description.example: Exclude testing domains from the tunnel

host.description: The domain name to exclude from the tunnel. If `host` is present, `address` must not be present.

exclude_office_ips.description: Whether to add Microsoft IPs to Split Tunnel exclusions.

description.description: A description of the fallback domain, displayed in the client UI.
description.example: Domain bypass for local development

dns_server.description: A list of IP addresses to handle domain resolution.

suffix.description: The domain suffix to match when resolving locally.

address.description: The address in CIDR format to include in the tunnel. If address is present, host must not be present.

description.description: A description of the split tunnel item, displayed in the client UI.
description.example: Include testing domains from the tunnel

host.description: The domain name to include in the tunnel. If host is present, address must not be present.

lan_allow_minutes.description: The amount of time in minutes a user is allowed access to their LAN. A value of 0 will allow LAN access until the next WARP reconnection, such as a reboot or a laptop waking from sleep. Note that this field is omitted from the response if null or unset.

lan_allow_subnet_size.description: The size of the subnet for the local access network. Note that this field is omitted from the response if null or unset.

match.description: The wirefilter expression to match devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings profile.

precedence.description: The precedence of the policy. Lower values indicate higher precedence. Policies will be evaluated in ascending order of this field.

mode.description: The mode to run the WARP client under.

port.description: The port number when used with proxy mode.

support_url.description: The URL to launch when the Send Feedback button is clicked.

switch_locked.description: Whether to allow the user to turn off the WARP switch and disconnect the client.

id.description: The id of the DEX test targeting this policy

name.description: The name of the DEX test targeting this policy

tunnel_protocol.description: Determines which tunnel protocol to use.

allow_mode_switch.description: Whether to allow the user to switch WARP between modes.

allowed_to_leave.description: Whether to allow devices to leave the organization.

auto_connect.description: The amount of time in minutes to reconnect after having been disabled.

captive_portal.description: Turn on the captive portal after the specified amount of time.

disable_auto_fallback.description: If the `dns_server` field of a fallback domain is not present, the client will fall back to a best guess of the default/system DNS resolvers unless this policy option is set to `true`.

exclude_office_ips.description: Whether to add Microsoft IPs to Split Tunnel exclusions.

mode.description: The mode to run the WARP client under.

port.description: The port number when used with proxy mode.

support_url.description: The URL to launch when the Send Feedback button is clicked.

switch_locked.description: Whether to allow the user to turn off the WARP switch and disconnect the client.
